title: Trump launches scathing but false attack on Democrat Dan McCready and ‘American-hating left’
text:
Donald Trump has launched a blistering but false attack on a Democratic congressional candidate, claiming without evidence he supports "open borders" and sanctuary cities.

Speaking to supporters in Fayetteville, North Carolina ahead of a special election Republicans are desperate to win, Mr Trump urged people to turn out and vote for Dan Bishop, who he claimed would be tough on immigration and strong on creating jobs.

By contrast, he claimed Democrat Dan McCready supported sanctuary cities and open borders, claims that local media says were not born out by the evidence.

Mr Trump had travelled to North Carolina on the eve on special election for the large 9th District, that was the subject of allegations of fraud in 2018 and where officials ordered a redo.

Mr Trump and vice president Mike Pence were both there to try and assure success for Republican Mr Bishop.

While the seat has long been held by Republicans, and while Mr Trump won North Carolina by around 12 points in 2016, Democrats hope their candidate, Mr McCready, can deliver a bloody noise, building on the party’s success in the 2018 midterms and making further inroads into areas Mr Trump considers his turf.

Opinion polling indicates a tight race, with turnout an important factor.

“It was a very close race,” Mr Trump said at the White House before leaving for Fayetteville. He said he believed Mr Bishop had a good chance of winning and that the contest had become “less close” since his own involvement began about two weeks ago. The president stressed, however, that “I'm not running”.

As he introduced the president, Mr Pence claimed the administration had made major differences over the last two-and-a-half years.

“President Trump promised to rebuild the military and President Trump has done that,” he said. “He has made America great again. But we need another four years to keep America great.”
